intro: Palicourea diguana, commonly known as the Guiana piper, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in Guyana, Suriname, and Brazil. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It produces small, red berries that are edible but often have a bitter taste. Palicourea diguana is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique appearance.
